summary.paragraph: textclock displays the current time on a web page. It is intended to be used as a Server Side Include program.

file.filedesc: This file. Instructions on how to install and use textclock.

introduction.paragraph: There are a number of variables that you can change in textclock.pl which alter the way that the program works.

description.paragraph: This should be set to 1 whilst you are installing and testing the script. Once the script is live you should change it to 0. When set to 1, errors will be output to the browser. This is a security risk and should not be used when the script is live.

Each of these variables controls the display of the relevant part of the date or time. If the variable is set to 1, then that part of the date/time is displayed. If it is set to 0 then that part of the date/time is omitted.

installation.paragraph: textclock is installed simply by copying the file textclock.pl.pl into your cgi-bin directory. If you don't know where your cgi-bin directory is, then please ask your system administrator
You may need to rename textclock.pl to textclock.cgi. Again, your system administrator will know if this is the case.

You will probably need to turn on execute permissions to the file. You can do this by running the command "chmod +x textclock.pl" from your command line. If you don't have command line access to your web server then there will probably be an equivalent function in your file transfer program.
